page.title: 09Parbold Community Centre
page.content: Built during the war for storage,the centre is now owned by the Parish Council.With a Sports Hall,lounges, kitchen,store and large foyer it offers facilities for clubs etc.A play group for 25 children meets every week-day, Mums and Toddlers,Judo,Bridge,Gardening and Keep Fit groups meet regularly. Whist drives are held to raise money for charity.The Community holds 4 events in a year,eg 20/7/85 a Hawaiian Disco and Barbecue,it will bring local people together.Private parties for 21st birthdays,weddings etc are held. The Parbold "Knockout" Group raised several thousand pounds which was used to create a play area by the Centre with swings,slide,roundabout,moonscape climbing frame and see-saw.A Night School of 2 terms for Geology is sometimes held(University of Liverpool Institute for External Studies).
